showScoreExcerpt:
“ ‘A Doll’s House’ was considered shocking in its day for showing Nora’s rejection of that trap. When she steps out of the Helmer home and quite literally into the 21st century in this boldly conceived, commandingly acted production, it’s both shattering and exhilarating.”

Read more
